channel.title: Grant proposal for federation in Gitea
channel.description:
Hi @cjs,
Only now do I discover the [Go-Fed Work Tracker Megathread](https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/go-fed-work-tracker-megathread/1170) and the grant proposal part:
> * Write [NGI0 Discovery](https://nlnet.nl/propose/) grant proposals: > * For ActivityPub [testsuite](https://github.com/go-fed/testsuite) completion > * For engineering of an OCAP-based transport/routing protocol based off of [eris](https://github.com/cjslep/eris) and [scr](https://github.com/cjslep/scr)
I would be very motivated to work with you on a grant application to implement [federation in Gitea with go-fed](https://discourse.gitea.io/t/forgefed-federation-in-gitea/1157). I have [some experience](https://forum.fedeproxy.eu/c/funding/5) and although I do not really enjoy the administrative process (I'm a developer at heart), I acknowledge that there is value in [clearly articulating the goals and outline the process to get there](https://forum.fedeproxy.eu/uploads/short-url/67QsDhlh47dpvuJxZf4hAsffZF9.pdf).
To the best of my knowledge there is no ongoing call for proposal at the moment, therefore no pressure, which I like (being extremely bad at doing things at the last minute). There will however surely be at least a few open calls by the end of the year and it would help continue the effort that will hopefully be bootstrapped if a developer is motivated to take baby steps with [the seed funding](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/issues/14186) (tiny tiny seed :seedling: :-) ) that was made available this week to work on federation for Gitea.
What do you think?
